H0.text: Gel electrophoresis is an analytical technique using a stained gel that can separate DNA fragments or RNA molecules and proteins.

H1.text: Microwave electrophoresis is an analytical technique that uses a stained gel to separate DNA fragments, RNA molecules, and proteins.

H2.text: Surface electrophoresis is an analytical technique that uses a stained gel to separate DNA fragments or RNA molecules and proteins.

H3.text: Static electrophoresis is an analytical technique that, using a stained gel, can separate DNA fragments or RNA molecules and proteins.

A4.text: Gel electrophoresis uses staining methods such as ethidium bromide for DNA and silver stain for proteins to visualize separated molecules.

A5.text: Gel electrophoresis separates DNA, RNA, and proteins based on their size and charge through a gel matrix of agarose, polyacrylamide, or other substances.
